content: waist at widest point 52sts 45sts 7sts enough to make medium neck 20sts 16sts 4sts weebee 2 inches or so smaller head at widest point 66sts 54sts 12sts than the standard size doll arms 12sts 9sts 3sts therefore if you use a smaller hook and/or yarn weight and follow the standard size patterns for the clothing and hair caps they should fit with maybe some very minor adjustments as suggested below… hints tips & advice 1 always read the clothing patterns fully and try on the items when the pattern says to then you can adjust your hook size as appropriate and rework the item you re making to suit your doll 2 keep trying the clothing onto your doll to check the sizing so you can make adjustments as necessary for example - if there are any straight row or rounds multiple row or rounds with the same amount of stitches you can always add or omit a round or two to suit your particular doll 3 remember you can always swap straight rounds see 2 above of half_double_crochet for straight rounds of half_double_crochet and swap straight rounds of double_crochet for straight rounds of half_double_crochet in order to shorten the length of say a dress sleeves or pant legs just keep trying the clothing on to test the length and adjust as appropriate 4 i cannot guarantee that every pattern will work this way but the majority should and have proven to during testing as you will see below remember if you re fairly new to weebee dolls and/or amigurumi work and this advice doesn t work for you right now that the standard size doll which all of the patterns have been designed to fit is also free and available here or you could complete the baby doll mod kit for this doll please see page 4 here are some examples worked up by myself and my wonderful testers… this is my doll whom i have called lottie 😊 she is made from aran/worsted/10ply/no 4 weight yarn with a 3mm crochet hook to make her clothing i used dk/light worsted/8ply/no 3 weight yarn with either a 2 5mm or a 3mm hook i kept trying on the clothing as i worked and simply reworked in a different hook sizes as appropriate if it seemed a little too small or a little too big mainly the 3mm hook seemed the best fit though i did have to omit the odd straight round or two see 2 above from the patterns ~ 2 ~ for example i didn t work rounds 13 and 14 of the mermaid tail and went straight from round 12 to 15 and i also swapped the odd round of half_double_crochet for a round single_crochet instead to reduce the length see 3 on previous page for example the mermaid tail starts with two rounds of half_double_crochet which i swapped for single_crochet given that medium weebee is a smaller doll and the rounds didn t need that
